0.title: Video of Johnny Depp drawing during his defamation trial goes viral
0.article_body: A video of Johnny Depp doodling during his defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard has gone viral on social media. In the video, Depp can be seen drawing a picture on a notepad while LAPD officer Tyler Hadden testified in court over the incident that took place in May 2016. Later, Depp was seen showing his doodle to his attorney.

1.title: Music should be heard rather than be seen: Aamir on releasing 'Kahani' on radio
1.article_body: Aamir Khan unveiled a song titled 'Kahani' from his upcoming film, 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. Aamir said he released the song on a radio station because a song deserves to be heard than just be seen with the help of visuals. Speaking about the song, he said, "I...believe that the songs in 'Laal Singh Chaddha' are the soul of the film."

2.title: Germany top buyer of Russian energy since invasion began: Study
2.article_body: A study published by the Centre for Research on Energy and Clean Air (CREA) shows that Germany has been the top buyer of Russian energy since Russia's invasion of Ukraine began on February 24. The CREA said Russia has earned €63 billion from fossil fuel exports of which Germany has paid about €9.1 billion since February 24.

3.title: Especially inappropriate: Kasparov on Djokovic supporting Russian players
3.article_body: Reacting to world number one men's tennis player Novak Djokovic's support for Russian players, ex-Russian chess grandmaster Garry Kasparov tweeted, "Russian athletes who don't condemn Putin...are supporting [him]. A [Serbian] failing to do so is especially inappropriate." "I personally believe there is no need to suspend Russian players. Competing is their right," Djokovic had earlier said.

4.title: Reels hard to monetise despite being popular: Zuckerberg
4.article_body: Reels account for over 20% of the time that users spend on Instagram, but they're hard to monetise for now, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg said during the company's Q1 2022 earnings call. He added that currently AI recommendations are driving more of user feeds than social content. This will unlock "interesting" content that users would've otherwise missed, he noted.

5.title: We're all going to die some day, nuclear strike more probable: Russian TV host
5.article_body: Amid war with Ukraine, Russian state TV host Margarita Simonyan has said that everything will end with a nuclear strike, adding, "To me, it's more probable than the other outcome." "We will go to heaven, while they (enemies) will simply croak...We're all going to die someday," she said. Simonyan further said that she thinks World War-III is more realistic.

6.title: 'Sooryavansham' appeals to people, they show it again and again: Abhishek
6.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan said there is something about his father and actor Amitabh Bachchan's movie 'Sooryavansham' that appeals to people. "Sooryavansham is one of the most successful films for the channel when it comes on satellite. They keep showing it again and again," he said, adding, "I think 20-21 years since its release, and it still comes on satellite television."

7.title: DC can send Shardul Thakur up the order: Virender Sehwag
7.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has said he's concerned about DC's batting in IPL 2022. He added that Shaw and Warner need to play longer innings for DC to have the advantage. He further said, "You can send Shardul Thakur up the order. He hasn't been doing much with the ball...could maybe come up with useful contributions with the bat."

8.title: Police arrest 8 people for school teacher's murder in Bihar's Buxar
8.article_body: Bihar Police on Thursday arrested eight people in connection with the murder of a school teacher in Buxar. Saroj Singh, who was the main witness to his brother Chitranjan's murder, was killed on April 19. Saroj had reportedly refused to turn hostile in his brother's murder trial, following which two people were hired on contract to kill him, police said.

9.title: PM Modi lays foundation stones for healthcare, education projects in Assam
9.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi laid foundation stones for healthcare and education projects including a Veterinary College in Assam's Diphu, Degree College in West Karbi Anglong and Agricultural College in Kolonga on Thursday. He also addressed the public at the 'Peace, Unity and Development Rally' in Diphu and said, "Since 2014...difficulties in the North East are reducing, people are developing."

10.title: Global chipmakers evaluating sites in India for new plants: Govt
10.article_body: Some of the world's biggest chipmakers are evaluating locations in India for new plants, Communications, Electronics and IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw told Bloomberg Television. India is in discussion with some of the world's largest firms to attract them into the country. "India is right there squarely on their global plans whether it is Intel, GlobalFoundries," he added.

11.title: Lookout notice issued against Vijay Babu in rape case, suspected to be out of the country
11.article_body: Kerala Police has issued a lookout circular against Malayalam actor-producer Vijay Babu who's facing a rape case. Babu went into hiding after the police registered a case against him based on the complaint of a woman who had accused him of sexually abusing her several times in the last one and half months. Police suspect he's out of the country.

12.title: 2 more arrested in connection with Delhi's Jahangirpuri violence
12.article_body: Delhi Police on Wednesday arrested two more persons in connection with the Jahangirpuri violence that took place on April 16. Police said that while scanning CCTV cameras and mobile videos, they found one accused roaming around with the crowd with a sword during the violence. The other accused was found to be instigating the crowd during the violence, police added.

13.title: Facing my first shot: Jaya Prada on throwback picture from her 1st movie
13.article_body: Actress Jaya Prada took to Instagram to share a throwback picture. "Throwback pic...Me facing my first shot in my movie," she captioned the picture. Her fans took to the comments section to say that she looks beautiful. "Too gorgeous ma'am," one fan commented while the other said, "Pic is not clear but you are clear."

14.title: J&K Police disallows Ramadan's last Friday prayers at Jamia Masjid suspecting protest
14.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir government has decided not to allow last Friday prayers of Ramadan at Srinagar's Jamia Masjid this year, citing difficulty in managing huge congregation. "Traditionally, it is a huge congregation and it can easily spiral into an Azadi protest," a police officer said. On April 9, 'Azadi' slogans were raised inside the mosque after the Friday prayers.

15.title: Twitter's top lawyer Vijaya Gadde abused online after Musk's tweets target her
15.article_body: Twitter's top lawyer Vijaya Gadde is being targeted with abusive tweets after Elon Musk, who's buying Twitter for $44 billion, criticised a content decision of Twitter's legal team. On a user's tweet about Gadde, Musk criticised Twitter's 2020 decision to block a story about Hunter Biden. Musk also tweeted a meme about Twitter's alleged "left-wing bias", which featured Gadde.

16.title: Orange warning issued for 5 states/UTs as temperatures cross 45°C; list released
16.article_body: IMD scientist RK Jenamani on Thursday said that some parts of country recorded temperatures above 45°C yesterday, adding, "In view of this, we've announced an orange warning for Rajasthan, Delhi, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh and Odisha." IMD has warned about heatwave conditions over northwest and central India during the next five days and over east India during next three days.

17.title: DC players to wear special jersey against KKR tonight, share pics
17.article_body: The players of Delhi Capitals (DC) will wear a special jersey tonight in their IPL 2022 match against KKR. The special match shirts worn during the match will be auctioned off by the franchise. Every bid placed by a fan for the special match shirts will help raise funds for the Inspire Institute of Sport (IIS) Vijayanagar.

18.title: Wanted to start lingerie business 15 yrs ago, plan never saw light of day: Vineeta
18.article_body: Shark Tank India judge and SUGAR Cosmetics CEO Vineeta Singh wrote on LinkedIn that she wanted to start a lingerie business 15 years ago. She said, "That business plan never saw the light of day." She also wrote, "It's tough to build something. It's just a little bit tougher if you're building for women, with women as a woman."

19.title: Efforts on to remove entire northeast from AFSPA's ambit: PM Modi
19.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday said the Centre is working to ensure that the entire northeast region is removed from the ambit of the Armed Forces (Special Powers) Act (AFSPA). He said Meghalaya and Tripura were removed from AFSPA's ambit because there has been a 75% drop in violent incidents in the region in the last eight years.

20.title: SC to hold final hearing on pleas challenging sedition on May 5
20.article_body: The Supreme Court will hold the final hearing on pleas challenging constitutional validity of the sedition law under IPC Section 124A on May 5, a bench led by CJI N V Ramana said. The bench asked the Centre to submit its response by the end of the week, after which the petitioners will be allowed to file their counter.

21.title: UK minister accused of watching porn on mobile phone in parliament, probe on
21.article_body: A UK minister has been accused of watching porn on mobile phone while sitting alongside a female member in the country's parliament. The Conservative Party's chief whip has ordered an investigation into the allegations against the minister. The UK government's safeguarding minister Rachel Maclean said that she wants to see the minister "out of parliament and out of the party".

22.title: I'll do it one day: Umran on bowling 155 kmph delivery in IPL 2022
22.article_body: On being asked if he's targeting to hit 155 kmph with the ball in the ongoing IPL season, SRH pacer Umran Malik said, "God willing if I've to bowl 155, I'll do it one day." Umran, however, also added that he's only looking to bowl well in the tournament. The 22-year-old has picked 15 wickets in eight games so far.

23.title: Man throws acid on woman for rejecting marriage proposal in Bengaluru
23.article_body: A 27-year-old man in Bengaluru allegedly threw acid on a 24-year-old woman for rejecting his marriage proposal. The incident happened at the staircase of the victim's office building in Sunkadakatte on Thursday. The woman has reportedly sustained more than 25% burn injuries and is being treated at a hospital. Police have launched a manhunt to arrest the accused, Nagesh.

24.title: 2 crushed to death, 3 injured as cars collide on Pune-Solapur highway
24.article_body: Two persons died and three others were injured after two cars collided with each other near the Kavadi Pat toll plaza on the Pune-Solapur highway on Thursday, police said. The impact of the collision was so severe that both cars were badly damaged and people inside them were crushed, police added. Meanwhile, an investigation has been launched into the incident.

25.title: Furniture startup WoodenStreet raises ₹230 cr at ₹1,200 cr valuation
25.article_body: Online furniture and home decor platform WoodenStreet has raised ₹230 crore ($30 million) at a valuation of ₹1,200 crore, the Jaipur-based D2C company announced on Wednesday. The Series B funding round was led by WestBridge Capital. The company closed Series A funding of $3 million from IAN and Rajasthan Venture Capital Funds in 2020.

26.title: I had conspiracy theories: Hiddink on Chelsea's 2nd leg vs Barcelona in 2009
26.article_body: Discussing the second leg of Chelsea's Champions League semi-final against Barcelona in 2009, Guus Hiddink who was then Chelsea's interim manager said, "Some people argued it was fixed. I started to have a few conspiracy theories." Chelsea were knocked out of the Champions League on the basis of the away goals rule, after it ended 1-1 on aggregate.

27.title: 62 terrorists killed in encounters so far this year: IGP Kashmir
27.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir Police on Thursday said 62 terrorists have been killed in encounters so far this year. Out of these, 47 were local terrorists and 15 were foreign terrorists, said Inspector-General of Police (IGP), Kashmir, Vijay Kumar. While 39 of the total terrorists killed belonged to Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT), 15 were from Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM), he added.

28.title: Putin vows 'lightning-fast' response to any foreign interference in Ukraine
28.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin warned if any country interferes in the ongoing Ukraine conflict it'd be met with a "lightning-fast" military response from Moscow. "We have all the tools for this, things no one else can boast of having now. And we will not boast, we will use them if necessary. And I want everyone to know that," Putin said.

29.title: 91-year-old Odissi dancer evicted, Padma Shri citation seen lying on road in Delhi
29.article_body: Centre has started evicting artistes who were allotted bungalows on rent in Delhi's Asiad village in 1980s. On Tuesday, 91-year-old Odissi dancer Guru Mayadhar Raut was evicted and his Padma Shri citation was seen lying on road. His daughter Madhumita said, "I'm extremely hurt and broken today...He doesn't deserve to be thrown out like this. Every citizen deserves basic dignity."

30.title: Around 5,000 active cases in Delhi but severity going down: Satyendar Jain
30.article_body: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain on Wednesday said though the number of COVID-19 cases in the capital is increasing, its severity is going down. "There are around 5,000 active COVID cases in Delhi, but hospital admissions are very few, as the entire population of Delhi is vaccinated," he said. "We have 10,000 beds...If needed, we'll increase the number," he added.

31.title: Unfortunately in Maha, we don't have any 'yogis' but 'bhogis': Raj Thackeray
31.article_body: MNS chief Raj Thackeray congratulated UP CM Yogi Adityanath for removing thousands of loudspeakers from religious places, "especially the masjids" in the state. "Unfortunately in Maharashtra, we don't have any 'yogis'; what we have are 'bhogis'. Here's hoping and praying good sense prevails," Thackeray said. UP government removed 10,900 "illegal" loudspeakers from religious places till Wednesday.

32.title: Ugly display of faith to harass others won’t be tolerated: UP CM Yogi
32.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath said it won’t be tolerated if people indulge in an "ugly display" of their faith to harass others. "There is full respect for all the faiths, there is no interference by the state government in religious practices but common people shouldn't be harassed," he added. "We proved that UP can remain free of riots," he stated.

33.title: She hit me with metal rod: Rob Kardashian on 'toxic' relationship with Blac Chyna
33.article_body: Speaking about his relationship with ex-fiancée Blac Chyna, television personality Rob Kardashian said, "It wasn't...real...love or we'd have been married. I didn't want to be married to someone like that. It was a toxic relationship." Kardashian also revealed the alleged abuse where Chyna got violent and hit him with a six-foot metal rod and pointed an unloaded gun at him.

34.title: Hair Care Juice reduces hair fall on 93% of our users in 6 weeks: Kapiva
34.article_body: According to a study conducted among Kapiva Academy of Ayurveda's consumers, 93% claim they experienced less hair fall after using Hair Care Juice. The combination of Noni, Bhringraj, Ashwagandha & Amla stimulates scalp's bloodstream, replaces dead cells in hair follicles, and combats breakage & hair loss due to stress, Kapiva stated. Furthermore, 70% users experienced faster & newer hair growth.

35.title: Most pleasing thing about Umran is that he wants to learn, improve: Moody
35.article_body: Praising their pacer Umran Malik, SRH head coach Tom Moody said the most pleasing thing about the 22-year-old is that he wants to "learn and improve". Moody added, "Umran is still very new to this high-pressure cricket. I'm sure he'll gain more and more confidence in IPL." Umran picked a five-wicket haul against GT on Wednesday.

36.title: Hardik Patel not holding talks with us despite invitation: Gujarat Cong chief
36.article_body: Gujarat Congress chief Jagdish Thakor criticised Hardik Patel by saying that he is giving anti-party statements in the media and not making himself available to resolve the differences when invited for talks with party members. "I called him last week and again yesterday. Last time he said he was busy...Later, he said he was in Surat," Thakor said.

37.title: Karachi University suicide bomber's husband arrested
37.article_body: Security officials have arrested the husband of the 30-year-old woman who blew herself up at the University of Karachi in Pakistan on Tuesday. This is reportedly the first arrest in connection with the blast case. Four people, including three Chinese nationals, were killed and several others were injured in the blast claimed by the Balochistan Liberation Army (BLA).

38.title: A regional language is the most important: Karnataka CM on national language debate
38.article_body: Referring to Ajay Devgn and Kiccha Sudeep's argument over national language debate, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said, "What Sudeep said was correct...A regional language is the most important as a state is formed on linguistic bases." He added, "Everyone should understand and respect what Sudeep...said." Referring to KGF: Chapter 2's success, Sudeep said Hindi is "no more" a national language.

39.title: Sickening to see the violence against Muslims celebrated in India: Padma Lakshmi
39.article_body: Indian-American model and author Padma Lakshmi has tweeted, "Sickening to see violence against Muslims celebrated in India. The widespread anti-Muslim rhetoric...poisons people." "Fellow Hindus, don't succumb to this fear-mongering. There is no threat to Hinduism in India or anywhere else. People of all faiths should be able to live peacefully together in this ancient...land.," she wrote.

40.title: Teachers told my parents there's something wrong with me: Zerodha CEO
40.article_body: Zerodha's Billionaire CEO Nithin Kamath in an interview discussed his school days and said his teachers called his parents several times and told them that "there is something wrong with your son". Talking about taking up entrepreneurship Kamath said, "It was accidental." He added he quit his job at a call centre and started portfolio management.

41.title: CCI conducts raids against Amazon's 2 Indian sellers: Report
41.article_body: The Competition Commission of India has launched raids against two domestic Amazon sellers, Cloudtail and Appario, over alleged violation of competition laws, Reuters reported citing sources. The raids, being carried out in New Delhi and Bengaluru, are related to CCI's investigation ordered in January 2020. Earlier, Amazon had been accused of promoting preferred sellers on websites.

42.title: Haryana Police constable dies after accidentally firing his service rifle
42.article_body: A constable of Haryana Police died after he accidentally fired his service rifle at his house on Tuesday. The deceased, identified as Pitamber, reportedly came home late after duty and brought the rifle with him. Next day, he started cleaning the rifle, when it accidentally went off. Pitamber was rushed to the hospital where doctors declared him dead.

43.title: Tiger Shroff, Tara Sutaria visit temple, dargah ahead of Heropanti 2 release
43.article_body: Actors Tiger Shroff and Tara Sutaria visited Babulnath temple and Mahim dargah in Mumbai ahead of the release of their upcoming film, 'Heropanti 2'. Tara and Tiger carried a basket of flowers on their head as they entered the Mahim dargah. The duo donned ethnic attire as they sought blessings for the success of their forthcoming film 'Heropanti 2'.

44.title: 5 coal miners killed by gunmen in Afghanistan
44.article_body: Five coal miners were killed by unidentified gunmen in Afghanistan's Samangan province on Tuesday, according to media reports. The victims were said to be robbed before being shot by the attackers. The incident took place in the Kotal Regi area of the Dara-e-Sof district. All the victims were reportedly from the Hazara community.

45.title: Govt asks electric two-wheeler makers to halt new launches due to fire incidents: Reports
45.article_body: The government has asked electric two-wheeler manufacturers to halt new launches until EV fire incidents were investigated, reports said. The government has also cautioned manufacturers who did not have incidents to take corrective measures, reports added. The makers have also been asked to recall EVs from the particular batch of vehicles that the fires were reported on recently, reports stated.

46.title: Amazon permanently lifts ban on mobile phones in warehouses: Report
46.article_body: Amazon has permanently lifted the ban on mobile phones in warehouses allowing workers to keep mobile phones with them on the job, Bloomberg reported citing an internal email. "We recognise the desire for employees to keep their mobile phones...and...last two years have demonstrated that we can safely do so," it said. The new policy will be applicable worldwide.

47.title: Maha govt collected ₹79,412 cr as fuel taxes since 2018: Hardeep Puri
47.article_body: Union Minister for Petroleum and Natural Gas Hardeep Singh Puri took to Twitter to question the Maharashtra government's decision to not reduce Value Added Tax (VAT) on fuel. "Maharashtra...collected ₹79,412 crore...fuel taxes since 2018 and is expected to collect ₹33,000 crore this year," he stated. "Why did it not reduce VAT on petrol...diesel to provide relief to people?" he added.

48.title: Coercive, not co-operative: Rahul on PM's fuel tax appeal to states
48.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said 68% of all fuel taxes is taken by the Centre, yet, PM Narendra Modi abdicates the responsibility. "High fuel prices - blame states, coal shortage - blame states, oxygen shortage - blame states...(PM) Modi’s federalism isn't cooperative. It’s coercive," Gandhi tweeted. His remark comes after PM Modi urged several states to cut VAT on fuel.

49.title: Maha Police seizes 89 swords from vehicle on Mumbai-Agra highway, 4 held
49.article_body: Maharashtra Police on Thursday seized 89 swords and one dagger from a Scorpio vehicle, on its way from Chittorgarh in Rajasthan, on the Mumbai-Agra highway in Dhule and arrested four men. There is no clarity on where the weapons were headed to, police said. BJP leader Ram Kadam questioned why swords from a Congress-ruled state were being brought to Mumbai.

50.title: Machine Gun Kelly & I consume each other's blood for ritual purposes: Megan Fox
50.article_body: Actress Megan Fox, speaking to Glamour magazine, opened up about she and her fiancé, singer Machine Gun Kelly, drinking each other's blood. "I guess to drink each other's blood might mislead people or people are imagining us with goblets...It's just a few drops, but yes, we do consume each other's blood on occasion for ritual purposes only," she stated.

51.title: Pooja Hegde is social media queen, what she posts has impact: Ram Charan
51.article_body: Actor Ram Charan said that actress Pooja Hegde is a social media queen and is good at it. "'Arabic Kuthu' was all over the place. We were shooting and...were waiting for next shot to set up and...I saw boys and girls...listening to 'Arabic Kuthu' and 'Butta Bomma'. It's coming out...in my Reels also...whatever Pooja posts makes an impact," he added.

52.title: Cong mute spectator to crimes against women in Rajasthan: Anurag Thakur
52.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Wednesday criticised Congress over 'rise in crime' against women in Rajasthan. "In Hathras, the way Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi came forward and Sonia Gandhi made incessant statements...Why have Sonia ji, Rahul ji and Priyanka ji turned mute spectators now?" Thakur asked. He also accused Congress of creating tensions among different communities in Rajasthan.

53.title: UN to send team to evacuate civilians from Mariupol steel plant
53.article_body: The United Nations said that it is sending an experienced team from the world over, in partnership with International Committee of the Red Cross, to evacuate people trapped in a steel plant in Ukraine's Mariupol. About 2,000 troops and 1,000 civilians are said to be trapped in bunkers below the damaged structure.

54.title: Mohali woman with blindfold after surgery loses purse to unidentified man
54.article_body: An unidentified man took away a woman’s purse while she was waiting in her daughter’s car, blindfolded after undergoing an eye operation at Mohali’s Sohana Hospital on Wednesday. The purse contained an iPhone, Apple Watch, ₹6,000, a pair of gold earrings and bangles, besides her PAN card, Aadhaar card, bank passbook and credit card, the victim’s daughter said.

55.title: Musk says Twitter needs to be politically neutral for public trust, explains what he means
55.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk, who recently announced that he would buy Twitter, has said, "For Twitter to deserve public trust, it must be politically neutral." He further explained that it effectively means "upsetting the far right and the far left equally". Earlier, Musk said that former US President Donald Trump's Truth Social exists because Twitter censored free speech.

56.title: Your ignorance is baffling: Ramya on Devgn's 'Hindi is national language' remark
56.article_body: Reacting to actor Ajay Devgn's 'Hindi was, is and will always be our national language' remark, actress-politician Divya Spandana, who is known as Ramya, tweeted, "No, Hindi is not our national language." She added, "Your ignorance is baffling. And it's great that films like KGF, Pushpa and RRR have done so well in Hindi belt...art has no language barrier."

57.title: 'KGF: Chapter 2' becomes third-highest grossing film in Hindi
57.article_body: 'KGF: Chapter 2' has become the third-highest grossing film in Hindi with a collection of ₹343 crore. It has beaten lifetime figures of Salman Khan's 'Tiger Zinda Hai' ( ₹339.16 crore), Aamir Khan's 'PK' (₹340.8 crore) and Ranbir Kapoor's 'Sanju' (₹342.53 crore). 'KGF: Chapter 2', which's originally made in Kannada, is inching towards the ₹1,000-crore mark at overall box office.

58.title: I once got angry at Pep Guardiola, we yelled in each other's faces: Aguero
58.article_body: Ex-Manchester City striker Sergio Aguero said he once got angry at Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola during a match against Tottenham Hotspur, with the two "yelling" in each other's faces. Discussing Guardiola's reaction after Riyad Mahrez missed a chance in the first leg of Manchester City's Champions League semi-final, Aguero stated he "doesn't like" Guardiola getting angry like that.

59.title: Elon Musk wins $13 bn suit over $2.6 bn Tesla-SolarCity deal
59.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has won a $13 billion lawsuit over Tesla's $2.6 billion acquisition of SolarCity, which Tesla shareholders had called a "bailout". They accused Musk of coercing Tesla's board into buying the struggling SolarCity, to rescue his investment. However, the US court found that Musk "was more involved in the process than a conflicted fiduciary should be".

60.title: BHU students burn VC's effigy in protest against Iftar party
60.article_body: In protest against the Iftar party organised by the Vice-Chancellor of Banaras Hindu University (BHU) on the campus, a group of students from the university burnt his effigy outside his residence on Wednesday. "VC is trying to impose a new tradition. This has never happened before in the university. He is trying to politicise the entire situation," a student said.

61.title: No load-shedding since a week in Maharashtra: MSEDCL chairman
61.article_body: Maharashtra has seen zero load-shedding for the last seven days, Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (MSEDCL) chairman Vijay Singhal said. "We were able to meet the highest demand of 25,150 MW," he added. "We could generate additional hydro-power from the Koyna dam...has a capacity of around 100 TMC (thousand million cubic feet) for hydro-power generation," Singhal stated.

62.title: Need to prepare for 'short, swift wars': Indian Air Force chief
62.article_body: The current geopolitical situation necessitates Indian Air Force to prepare for intense and small duration operations at a short notice, Chief of Air Staff Air Chief Marshal VR Chaudhari has said. In an address at a seminar, he also said there would be a need for the force to prepare for "short, swift wars" and be ready for "long-drawn standoff".

63.title: Tomatoes thrown at French President Macron during 1st appearance after re-election
63.article_body: Tomatoes were thrown at French President Emmanuel Macron during his first appearance in public since his re-election on Sunday. Macron was greeting people following his victory when someone from the crowd hurled tomatoes at him. The tomatoes, however, missed the French President and hit one of his security guards, who shouted "projectile".

64.title: My 1st marriage may not have worked but I haven't become anti-men: Kanika
64.article_body: Speaking about her first marriage and how she has dealt with her divorce, singer Kanika Kapoor said that she decided to go out and work after her separation. When asked about her relationship with her ex-husband, Raj Chandok, Kanika said they're cordial with each other. "My first marriage may not have worked...but I've not become anti-love or anti-men," she added.

65.title: TMC has no future in Goa: Party's state chief resigns
65.article_body: Blaming poll strategist Prashant Kishor for the upset in Assembly elections, Goa TMC chief Kiran Kandolkar on Wednesday resigned from the party. The party has no future in Goa, he said. He added he had nothing against party chief Mamata Banerjee. "Prashant Kishor is the one who leads I-PAC. If anyone has failed, it is him," said Kandolkar.

66.title: PM called meet for COVID, taunted CMs of non-BJP states on fuel price: Raut
66.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut criticised PM Narendra Modi's appeal to CMs of non-BJP ruling states to reduce VAT on fuel and said PM Modi "taunted" the CMs. "The CMs were told that PM Modi would hold a meeting on COVID...(He) was not expected to do so but CM Uddhav Thackeray and Mamata Banerjee have given the answer," Raut added.

67.title: It's sent shiver down B'wood filmmakers' spine: Manoj on South films' success
67.article_body: Discussing the success of South films, actor Manoj Bajpayee said, "It has sent a shiver down the spine of all the mainstream filmmakers from the Mumbai film industry. They...don't know where to look." "This is a lesson for Mumbai industry's mainstream filmmakers on how to make mainstream cinema," added Manoj. "They don't dumb [their films]...down for the audience," stated Manoj.

68.title: It's happening so often that I fear we'll run out of luck in knockouts: Hardik
68.article_body: After their last-ball win against SRH, GT captain Hardik Pandya jokingly said "God is helping" them out in the ongoing IPL season. "I keep joking in the dressing room that God is telling us 'You guys are good, I'll help you'. It's happening so often that I fear we may run out of luck in the knockout games," he stated.

69.title: Man sleeping on roadside killed after being run over by SUV in Pune
69.article_body: A 37-year-old SUV driver has been arrested for allegedly running over and killing an elderly man sleeping on the roadside near Pune's Salisbury Park on April 20. The police arrested the accused, Anup Mehta, on Tuesday after going through CCTV camera footage. The driver told police that he wasn't able to see the man due to the vehicle's big bonnet.

70.title: People in Srinagar gather on streets to protest power crisis
70.article_body: Locals in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar gathered on the streets to protest the ongoing power crisis on Wednesday. They claimed they don't get electricity for three to four hours a day which has impacted the businessmen and industrial unitholders. "This is the first time we are witnessing such a scenario in Kashmir," said Tariq Mughloo, Vice-President, Kashmir Economic Alliance.

71.title: Army jawans booked after 3 J&K policemen get injured over dispute
71.article_body: Indian Army jawans were booked after three policemen were reportedly injured over a dispute related to some construction work in Jammu. The Army is said to have objected to the construction by a civilian family, who claimed to have permission for renovation work from the authorities. The policemen sustained injuries when they intervened. The Army denied the assault charge.

72.title: OnePlus 10R 5G, Nord CE 2 Lite 5G and Nord Buds set to be launched today
72.article_body: OnePlus presents 'More Power to You', unveiling its latest array of products across categories. The OnePlus 10R 5G will come with 150W SuperVOOC charge support and MediaTek Dimensity 8100 MA processor whereas the OnePlus Nord CE 2 Lite will feature a 64MP AI triple camera setup. The new OnePlus Nord Buds will sport 12.4 mm dynamic bass drivers.

73.title: TN reduced tax on petrol before Centre's action: State Finance Min
73.article_body: Reacting to PM Narendra Modi's appeal to states to reduce VAT on fuel, Tamil Nadu's Finance Minister P Thiaga Rajan said that the Tamil Nadu government had reduced VAT on petrol back in August 2021, prior to the central government's action. "That cut resulted in a relief of ₹3/litre to the citizens of the state," the minister said.

74.title: RSS is like termite, spreading poison against society: Rajasthan Congress chief
74.article_body: Rajasthan Congress chief Govind Singh Dotasra on Wednesday said that the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) is like a "hidden termite" which is hollowing the society by spreading "poison". The Congress leader added that the RSS enjoys power behind the curtain and is not participating in direct politics to skirt accountability.

75.title: Centre owes Maha ₹26,500 cr, state not responsible for fuel price hike: Thackeray
75.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray said the Centre owes the state ₹26,500 crore after PM Narendra Modi stated some states did not reduce VAT on petrol and diesel despite Union government's excise duty cut. The state is not responsible for the hike in fuel prices, he added. "Maharashtra's contribution in direct taxes collection at the national level is 38.3%," Thackeray stated.

76.title: My decision to work in a film will never be based on my character's age: Mrunal
76.article_body: Mrunal Thakur, who played the role of a mother in 'Jersey', said her decision to work in a film will never be based on her character's age. "It's dependent on [whether] the script resonates with me or how challenging it would be to play [an]...older version of myself," she added. "Make-up...doesn't help elevate the performances in such cases," she said.

77.title: Canada Parliament votes Russia's invasion of Ukraine as 'genocide'
77.article_body: Canadian lawmakers on Wednesday voted unanimously to call Russia's invasion of Ukraine a 'genocide'. The members of the Canadian House of Commons said there was "ample evidence of systemic and massive war crimes against humanity" being committed by Russia. The motion said war crimes by Russia include mass atrocities, systematic instances of willful killing of Ukrainian civilians, and rape.

78.title: Musk is revealing just how unserious a person he is: Ex-Twitter exec
78.article_body: Former Twitter executive Jason Goldman in an interview discussing Elon Musk's Twitter takeover said, "The company really could use great stewardship at this point and what he's revealing is just how unserious a person he is." He also criticised Musk's plan to relax speech restrictions, saying it "reveals a very naive and unserious approach to...content moderation issues he will face".

79.title: Man kills 8-month pregnant relative in Mumbai, foetus dies inside womb
79.article_body: An eight-month pregnant woman was murdered by her husband's cousin who was staying with them since a few months in Mumbai. An official said that the woman was found dead at her home and added that the foetus also died inside her womb. The reason for killing her has not yet been ascertained. Police have arrested the accused.

80.title: 2 former Karnataka CMs reply to Ajay Devgn's 'Hindi is our national language' tweet
80.article_body: Two former Karnataka Chief Ministers Siddaramaiah and HD Kumaraswamy have responded to Ajay Devgn's tweet directed at Kannada actor Sudeep, saying Hindi is our national language. Siddaramaiah said, "Hindi was never and will never be our national language. It's the duty of every Indian to respect linguistic diversity of our country." Kumaraswamy said, "India is a garden of several languages."

81.title: Nope! we're still here: Twitter CEO Parag after user says 'I thought we were fired'
81.article_body: Responding to a user who tweeted, "I thought we were fired," Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal wrote, "Nope! we're still here." Reacting to his reply, Twitter users wrote, "Hopefully, for not much longer," and "Better start looking now." Earlier, a report said Agrawal would receive $42 million if he's terminated within 12 months of a change in control at Twitter.

82.title: NCP leader Khadse's wife gets interim relief from arrest in land scam case
82.article_body: Bombay High Court on Wednesday granted interim relief from arrest till June 20 to NCP leader Eknath Khadse's wife Mandakini Khadse in connection with the 2016 Pune land scam case. "She is arraigned as an accused in the case lodged by ED in 2019," Mandakini's advocate said. Mandakini said that this is the only case against her.

83.title: Can't compare Bhagavad Gita with Bible and Quran: K'taka Education Minister BC Nagesh
83.article_body: After a Bengaluru school allegedly made Bible reading compulsory, Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh said, "We can't compare Bhagavad Gita with Quran and Bible." He said, "Bible and Quran are religious texts. But Bhagavad Gita speaks about values needed to lead life." Earlier, Archbishop of Bengaluru questioned state government's plans to introduce Bhagavad Gita as the moral science syllabus.

84.title: RCB host Maxwell's wedding party, video of Kohli dancing on Pushpa song surfaces
84.article_body: RCB organised a wedding party in the bubble for newlyweds Glenn Maxwell and Vini Raman. A video of Virat Kohli dancing on Oo Antava song from movie 'Pushpa' at the wedding party has surfaced online. Anushka Sharma also shared pictures from the wedding party, writing, "I think I’ve seen and celebrated possibly every function and festival in a bubble!"

85.title: Proud of our people who are working with focus despite the noise: Twitter CEO
85.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal on Thursday said, "Proud of our people who continue to do the work with focus...despite the noise." Earlier, Agrawal told his employees, "There are no plans for any layoffs at this point." Recently, a report claimed that Twitter's General Counsel Vijaya Gadde cried in a meeting expressing concerns over Musk's takeover.

86.title: Exotic monkeys, wallaby rescued from 2 smugglers in Assam
86.article_body: Five exotic monkeys and a wallaby were rescued from two smugglers in Assam's North Kamrup on Wednesday. The accused were allegedly taking the caged animals to Hyderabad in a vehicle. One of the smugglers has been arrested, while the other managed to flee the spot, the forest department confirmed. The monkeys are believed to have been smuggled via Myanmar.

87.title: Corbett chief sacked, 2 IFS officers suspended over illegal construction
87.article_body: Uttarakhand government removed Rahul, the director of the Corbett Tiger Reserve and suspended two Indian Forest Service officers, JS Suhag and Kishan Chand from their posts on Wednesday. The High Court, in January, had directed to take action against the officials found guilty in the case of illegal constructions and felling of trees in the reserve's Pakhro and Morghati areas.

88.title: Liverpool defeat Villarreal to take 2-0 lead in Champions League semis
88.article_body: Liverpool defeated Villarreal 2-0 in the first leg of the Champions League semi-final. Liverpool's Jordan Henderson's deflected effort, which was ruled as Pervis Estupinan's own goal, opened the scoring while Sadio Mane doubled the lead in a two-minute span early in the second half. Liverpool are attempting to reach their third Champions League final in five years.

89.title: I won't say so: Anil on whether he is 'best friends' with Ranveer, Sanjay
89.article_body: Discussing whether he is 'best friends' with actors Ranveer Singh and Sanjay Dutt, actor Anil Kapoor said, "I won't say best friends. I am not so presumptuous that I am anybody's best friend." "I think we just respect...[and] love each other," added Anil. Anil and Ranveer starred together in the film 'Dil Dhadakne Do' which also featured Anushka Sharma.

90.title: I took this job to change Twitter for the better: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal
90.article_body: After Elon Musk struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion, Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal on Thursday tweeted, "I took this job to change Twitter for the better, course correct where we need to, and strengthen the service." "Proud of our people who continue to do the work with focus and urgency despite the noise," he added.

91.title: Man dupes over 170 people in investment scam in Mumbai, booked
91.article_body: Mumbai police have booked a man for duping over 170 people on the pretext of an investment scam. According to an FIR, the complainant, son of Vastu consultant Biindu Khuraana, said his family had invested around ₹60 lakh in 2020. Though, they initially received good returns, months later, they stopped receiving the money following which they approached police.

92.title: 3 members of Punjab-based gang held for uprooting ATM in Kurukshetra
92.article_body: The Kurukshetra Police arrested three members of a Punjab-based gang for allegedly uprooting an ATM containing ₹18.41 lakh cash from Shahbad in Kurukshetra earlier this month. Two members of the gang are absconding. The accused uprooted the ATM with the help of an SUV and took it along on the intervening night of April 8 and 9.

93.title: Guj woman injured after husband wanting her to quit studies assaults her
93.article_body: A woman was injured in Gujarat's Rajkot after her husband, who wanted her to not pursue her further studies, assaulted her. He also stopped her from going to get her examination hall ticket. The woman reportedly pleaded with him to let her complete her second year, after which, she said she'd quit studies but the husband abused and assaulted her.

94.title: BMC completes 25% of pre-monsoon desilting work across Mumbai
94.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has completed 25% of pre-monsoon desilting work across Mumbai, senior civic officials said on Wednesday. The civic body further aims to complete about 65% of work by May 15. Moreover, BMC is also creating a website with real-time data on desilting work in order to maintain transparency between citizens and the civic body, officials said.

95.title: J&K's Mughal Road reopens after remaining closed for over 4 months
95.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir's Mughal Road which connects Rajouri and Poonch districts of Jammu region with Shopian district of south Kashmir reopened for vehicular traffic on Wednesday. The road remained closed for over four months due to heavy snowfall in the area. Jammu's Divisional Commissioner ordered the reopening of the road, which was cleared of snow by the Mechanical Engineering Department.

96.title: Baidu, Pony.ai get 1st permits to deploy driverless robotaxis in China
96.article_body: Baidu and Pony.ai have received permits from Beijing city authorities to deploy their robotaxis without a safety driver, marking the first time such permits have been given in China. Both the firms are allowed to offer rides to the general public on open roads within a 60 square kilometre area in the Beijing Economic and Technological Development Area.

97.title: Delhi govt to develop 'world-class' factory complex at Jhandewalan
97.article_body: Delhi government is planning to develop a 'world-class' factory complex at Jhandewalan, Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said on Wednesday. "Development of conforming areas such as Jhandewalan will help the government generate employment opportunities by promoting labour intensive  manufacturing and service industrial activities," Sisodia said. The plan is a part of schemes announced under Rozgar Budget.

98.title: US & Russia swap prisoners amid Ukraine war tensions
98.article_body: The US and Russia on Wednesday swapped prisoners amid their most tense relations in decades over the Ukraine war. Ex-US Marine Trevor Reed, held in Russia since 2019, was exchanged for Russian pilot Konstantin Yaroshenko, who'd been serving a 20-year sentence for conspiring to smuggle cocaine into the US. Reed was jailed for assaulting two Russian police officers in Moscow.

99.title: Had a hole in my heart, blood clot travelled from that hole to my brain: Hailey
99.article_body: While talking about her hospitalisation in March, Hailey Bieber said that she experienced stroke-like symptoms from a "blood clot that traveled from a hole in her heart to her brain". Bieber added that tests revealed that she had a mini-stroke. She underwent a procedure to close the hole, which she says was between 12 and 13 millimetres.

100.title: 3 dead, 6 injured in Unnao after car overturns on Agra-Lucknow Expressway
100.article_body: At least three members of a family, including a six-month-old girl, were killed and six others were injured after a car overturned and was hit by another vehicle on the Agra-Lucknow Expressway, police said. The car was going to Gonda from Rajasthan and it jumped to the other lane and overturned before being hit by another car, police added.

101.title: UP has set an example by removing unnecessary loudspeakers: CM Yogi
101.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath said the state has set an example before the country by removing unnecessary loudspeakers installed at religious sites or reducing their volumes across UP with harmony. "Instructions given for the use of loudspeakers should be implemented strictly. The people should not face inconvenience and loudspeakers should not be installed at new sites," CM Yogi added.

102.title: Umran Malik hurricane is blowing away everything in its way: P Chidambaram on SRH pacer
102.article_body: After SRH pacer Umran Malik's five-wicket haul against GT, Congress leader P Chidambaram tweeted, "The Umran Malik hurricane is blowing away everything in its way...The sheer pace and aggression is a sight to behold." Adding that Umran is the find of IPL 2022, Chidambaram suggested BCCI should give him an exclusive coach and "quickly" induct him into the national team.

103.title: I'm not in favour of Umran being included in India's T20 WC squad: RP Singh
103.article_body: Ex-India pacer RP Singh has said he's not in favour of SRH pacer Umran Malik being included in India's squad for the 2022 T20 World Cup. "Umran is surely an exciting talent...But playing him right away? I'm not in favour...because he hasn't played much domestic and even in IPL, he has only just started to do well," explained Singh.

104.title: Why should govt suffer loss of face because of your negligence?: Mamata to police
104.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee criticised the state's police force saying that their "negligence" led to incidents of violence and rape. She said, "Why should the government have a loss of face because of your negligence?" This comes after nine people were burnt alive in Birbhum and a minor girl was allegedly raped by a TMC leader's son in Nadia.

105.title: Wrote poem for Big B, got letter he wrote next day: Runway 34 actress Aakanksha
105.article_body: 'Runway 34' actress Aakanksha Singh said that getting a handwritten letter from actor Amitabh Bachchan was a "very big deal" for her. She said she wrote a poem for the actor after he sent her a buggy when she had a fracture. "He had written...You will keep getting appreciation letters. But first, please accept this letter," Aakanksha added.

106.title: Improvised scene by putting nail paint on fingers: Nawazuddin on playing Laila
106.article_body: When asked if he was apprehensive about playing a feminine guy 'Laila' in 'Heropanti 2', actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui said that he was looking for a role that is "villainous" and "feminine" at the same time. "There's a scene where I'm putting nail polish on my fingers, it wasn't a part of the script initially, but I improvised it," he added.

107.title: Feels good, happy to deliver against SRH: Rashid Khan on 31*(11)
107.article_body: GT's Rashid Khan, who smashed unbeaten 31 runs off 11 balls on Wednesday, said he's happy to deliver against SRH. He added, "[I'm] just trying to play my game and have that belief [in] my batting which I'm working [on] for the last two years." Rashid smashed three sixes in final over to help GT chase down SRH's 195-run total.

108.title: UK govt proposes seizing crypto assets to help against economic crime
108.article_body: The UK government has proposed seizing crypto assets to help combat economic crime. It told the parliament's Treasury Select Committee that the creation of a civil forfeiture power would "mitigate the risk posed by those that cannot be prosecuted but use their funds to further criminality". The parliamentary inquiry recommended creating a single body to tackle economic crime.

109.title: Skulls found by Mexican police from AD 900, not a crime scene
109.article_body: A pile of about 150 skulls found in a Mexico cave in 2012, which the police believed to be a crime scene, turned out to be over a thousand years old. According to archaeologists, the skulls belonged to sacrificial victims killed between AD 900 and 1200. They said the victims were likely decapitated and their skulls put on display.

110.title: Expel me if you want me to join BJP: Shivpal to Akhilesh
110.article_body: Reacting to SP chief Akhilesh Yadav's remark that why was the BJP delaying induction of Shivpal Yadav, the latter said that if Akhilesh wanted him to join BJP then he should expel him from the party. "It's an irresponsible and childish statement. I'm one of 111 MLAs of SP who won in recent assembly elections," Shivpal said.

111.title: 36-yr-old property dealer held for killing 2 men in Prayagraj
111.article_body: A 36-year-old property dealer was arrested for allegedly killing two men involved in the sale and purchase of properties in Prayagraj's Dhoomanganj area on Wednesday, police said. The accused shot dead both the men after they had an argument over a property deal at the former's residence. The deceased and the accused were known to each other, police added.

112.title: UP govt removes 10,900 'illegal' loudspeakers from religious places
112.article_body: Uttar Pradesh government said it has removed 10,900 "illegal and unauthorised" loudspeakers from religious places across the state on Wednesday. "There's an existing 2018 order...there are set rules for sound decibel limits and court directions," it added. "Focus is to ensure the implementation of guidelines through dialogue, making everyone understand the norms through awareness," UP Police said.

113.title: Satyajit Ray did posters, music for films out of compulsion: Shoojit Sircar
113.article_body: Talking about late Indian filmmaker Satyajit Ray, director Shoojit Sircar said, "Ray is called a multi-talented director but this may be out of compulsion." "He [made] his own posters because probably he thought others won't realise it...the same way. Ray did music in his films as he wasn't sure...he could explain the context...in its entirety to another person," added Shoojit.

114.title: Mumbai court acquits builder, 4 police officials for planting drugs on agent
114.article_body: A special court acquitted a builder and four Mumbai Police officials, who were booked for planting drugs and a weapon on an estate agent. In 2004, 340 grams of heroin and a weapon were seized from the agent by Dongri Police. After the agent spent 150 days in jail, a probe revealed that he was falsely implicated by the accused.

115.title: 5 persons booked for attempted murder in Ludhiana after assaulting couple
115.article_body: Five persons were booked in Ludhiana for attempted murder after they assaulted a 23-year-old man and his wife with a baseball bat and a sword. The incident occurred on April 24, when the accused first assaulted the man over a verbal spat. Later, when his wife came to his rescue, the accused also assaulted her, according to the male complainant.

116.title: Astronauts launched by SpaceX reach International Space Station
116.article_body: The Crew-4 astronauts launched by SpaceX reached the International Space Station at 5:07 am IST on Thursday after a journey of nearly 16 hours. While three astronauts - Kjell Lindgren, Robert Hines, Jessica Watkins - are from NASA, the fourth - Samantha Cristoforetti is from European Space Agency. NASA said it was one of the fastest flights to the ISS.

117.title: Petrol will be cheaper if states cut taxes on fuel instead of liquor: Petroleum Minister
117.article_body: Union Minister for Petroleum and Natural Gas Hardeep Singh Puri on Thursday tweeted, "Petrol will be cheaper if opposition ruled states cut taxes on fuel instead of imported liquor!" He added, "Maharashtra govt imposes ₹32.15/ltr on petrol & Congress ruled Rajasthan ₹29.10. But BJP ruled Uttarakhand levies only ₹14.51 & Uttar Pradesh ₹16.50." He further wrote, "Protests cannot challenge facts!"

118.title: Gavaskar punched the ceiling, jumped and screamed: Pietersen on Umran taking 5 wickets
118.article_body: Ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen said the way ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar celebrated in the commentary box after SRH pacer Umran Malik's five-wicket haul was "more exciting" than the dismissals. Pietersen added that Gavaskar punched the ceiling, jumped and screamed. "I think he did that because how often have we seen India producing the fastest bowler in world cricket?" Pietersen stated.

119.title: North stars are jealous of south stars after KGF 2's success: Ram Gopal Varma
119.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn recently took offence to Kiccha Sudeep's "Hindi is not our national language" comment. Reacting to it, filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma took Sudeep's side and wrote, "The base undeniable ground truth @KicchaSudeep sir, is that the north stars are insecure and jealous of the south stars because a Kannada dubbing film #KGF2 had a ₹50 crore opening day."

120.title: Got attention in childhood; people clapped & whistled, I got addicted: Yash
120.article_body: Actor Yash said that he used to participate in a lot of cultural activities in his childhood. "I used to get that extra attention...people used to clap and whistle. So I think I got addicted to it at a very young age," he added. Yash further said that he always wanted to be a hero and never had plan B.

121.title: I didn't like how villains treated my mom in films: Mandakini's son Rabbil
121.article_body: 'Ram Teri Ganga Maili' actress Mandakini's son Rabbil Thakur said he did not watch any of his mother's films during his childhood, as he did not like watching them. "I used to not like seeing the way villains treated my mom. I [did not]...understand the concept that this is just a movie and she is just acting," added Rabbil.

122.title: SRK throwing T-shirts not act of negligence: HC on 2017 stampede incident
122.article_body: Gujarat High Court has quashed a criminal complaint against Shah Rukh Khan, observing that the actor throwing T-shirts and smiley balls at Vadodara railway station in 2017 while promoting 'Raees' cannot be termed acts of "high degree of negligence". According to the complaint, Khan threw the items at the crowd, which resulted in a stampede and death of a person.

123.title: Pic of Rahul Dravid throwing cap in anger resurfaces after Muralitharan's outburst
123.article_body: After Muttiah Muralitharan got angry and shouted in frustration during SRH's defeat against GT, fans recalled Rahul Dravid throwing his cap in anger during IPL 2014. Dravid, who was RR's mentor at the time, threw the cap after their defeat against MI. "Only tournament in the world that can make Dravid and Muralitharan lose their calm," a fan tweeted.

124.title: US govt's religious freedom body criticises India; Hindu council calls it 'Indophobic'
124.article_body: After US Commission on International Religious Freedom (USCIRF) recommended to the US administration to designate India and 14 other nations as "country of particular concern" in the context of status of religious freedom, HinduPACT said USCIRF has been taken over by "Indophobic and Hinduphobic members". "Many of these members have attended India and Hindu bashing events," HinduPACT added.

125.title: Maha man asked to shut up after fight with wife slaps constable, held
125.article_body: Kongaon Police arrested a man for slapping constable following fight with his wife. The accused tried to break the main door after thumping on it, after which, his wife got scared. "Our constables...brought...man to the police station...he started abusing police officials...when he was asked to shut up...he slapped...a constable and pushed others who tried to stop him," an officer said.

126.title: Truck speeds away for kilometres with toll official standing on bumper in Andhra
126.article_body: A video went viral showing a truck speeding away on a highway in Andhra Pradesh with a toll official standing on its bumper. As per reports, the driver was asked to pay a fine after which he sped away. The worker was reportedly scanning FASTag by standing on the bumper. The truck was reportedly stopped by police after several kilometres.

127.title: India reports 3,303 COVID-19 cases, 39 deaths in 24 hours
127.article_body: India has reported 3,303 COVID-19 cases, 2,563 recoveries and 39 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,927 COVID-19 cases and 32 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 16,980, while the death toll rose to 5,23,693.

128.title: US judge rejects Musk's bid to end Tesla tweets review under SEC deal
128.article_body: A US judge has rejected Tesla CEO Elon Musk's bid to end the condition to have his tweets on Tesla vetted by a competent lawyer before posting, a requirement under his US SEC deal. Musk has claimed he was forced to agree to the deal. The judge said Musk's free speech argument against the deal is "meritless" and "particularly ironic".

129.title: 2 youths arrested for stealing silencers of 14 cars in Pune
129.article_body: Two youths have been arrested for stealing silencers of 14 cars and selling their parts in Pune. According to police, the duo "would extract catalytic converter from these cars and extract the crushed material that has components of expensive elements". "We are yet to nab the person to whom they sold these elements," Loni Kalbhor Police Station officials said.

130.title: Need control over Delhi as it is the face of India: Centre to SC
130.article_body: Centre told the Supreme Court that it needs to have control over administrative services in Delhi as the world views India through its national capital. "It's necessary...Centre has powers over appointments and transfers of public servants. Delhi is the face of the nation," it added. SC was hearing petitions by the Delhi government against the Centre's control of civil services.

131.title: Fire breaks out at Chennai’s Rajiv Gandhi hospital, no casualties reported
131.article_body: A massive fire broke out at Chennai's Rajiv Gandhi government hospital around 11 am on Wednesday. "This was an unexpected accident which happened due to...short circuit," Health Minister Ma Subramanian said after visiting the spot. No injuries or casualties have been reported. Earlier, four fire tenders were rushed to the spot and more joined later to douse the fire.

132.title: India not part of climate problem but will play big role in solution: Union Minister
132.article_body: Union Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav on Wednesday said India is not a part of the climate problem but it wants to be and will be a big part of the solution. "To address climate change, technology transfer is necessary…India is among few G20 countries that have fulfilled its nationally determined contribution (NDC) under the Paris Agreement," Yadav stated.

133.title: Don't think Hardik Pandya will bowl a lot now in IPL 2022: Wasim Jaffer
133.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said GT captain Hardik Pandya, who hasn't bowled in his last two games, is unlikely to "bowl a lot" in their upcoming matches as the team has got all their bases covered. "GT will take care of Hardik and [he'll] only bowl if needed to...they've Lockie [Ferguson], [Mohammad] Shami, and Alzarri Joseph," explained Jaffer.

134.title: J&K Army-run school asks staff to avoid hijab; official clarifies
134.article_body: An Indian Army-run school in Jammu and Kashmir's Baramulla asked its staff to avoid wearing hijab during school hours. This triggered a controversy with several political leaders opposing the move. Following this, Defence spokesperson Emron Musavi clarified that the circular mistakenly mentioned hijab instead of 'niqab' [a veil which covers the entire face except for eyes].

135.title: Central Railway allows co-branding rights to stations in Mumbai division
135.article_body: The Central Railway has allowed private companies, corporates, banks and government agencies to brand their names in 83 stations, which includes almost all stations of Mumbai division to generate non-fare income. "We are in the bidding process right now. We have received interest from private companies for a few railway stations of Palghar and Dahanu," a Western Railway official said.

136.title: I'd love to work with Aishwarya, I enjoy working with her: Abhishek on wife
136.article_body: When asked if he would like to work with his wife, actress Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, anytime soon, actor Abhishek Bachchan said, "I'd love to collaborate with her again, but obviously, it has to be the right script at the right time." Speaking about his wife as an actor, Abhishek said that she is wonderful and he enjoys working with her.

137.title: Delhi Police busts fake arms licence racket, 4 people arrested
137.article_body: The Crime Branch of Delhi Police has busted a fake arms licence racket and arrested four persons. Based on a tip-off, police laid a trap and apprehended one person accused of carrying illegal arms. On further investigation, the other three accused were also arrested. About 15 fake arms licences, purportedly issued from Jammu and Kashmir, were recovered from the accused.

138.title: He has been bowling beautifully: Williamson on Umran's 5/25 vs GT
138.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson praised pacer Umran Malik for his performance against GT, stating that the 22-year-old is bowling beautifully in the tournament. "It was an outstanding performance [against GT]," he added. Umran picked a five-wicket haul in the game, conceding 25 runs. SRH lost the match after Rashid Khan smashed three sixes off Marco Jansen in the final over.

139.title: Karnataka reports 126 new COVID-19 cases; 114 in Bengaluru alone
139.article_body: Karnataka on Wednesday reported 126 new COVID-19 cases out of which 114 were reported in Bengaluru alone. The city also recorded 92 daily coronavirus recoveries and a positivity rate of 3.06%, according to data published by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP). Notably, with the new cases, the total number of active coronavirus cases in Bengaluru has risen to 1,648.

140.title: Guj teacher arrested for derogatory WhatsApp post against minority
140.article_body: A school teacher was arrested in Gujarat's Ahmedabad for allegedly sharing a derogatory post against a minority community on WhatsApp. The police said the accused, Manisha Bhavsar, "was part of several WhatsApp groups where she had shared and saved posts that were derogatory against the Muslim community". "After technical surveillance and investigation, the accused was arrested," added police.

141.title: Hyderabad Police busts organised gambling racket, 7 held
141.article_body: Hyderabad's Banjara Hills Police busted an organised gambling racket in Yousufguda's Sri Krishna Nagar area. Acting on credible information, police conducted a raid and arrested seven accused persons, including the (gambling) organiser. The organiser used to invite punters, who have the habit of gambling by betting money and gaining easy money illegally, Banjara Hills SHO said.

142.title: UK Finance Minister Rishi Sunak cleared of ethics breach over wife's non-dom status
142.article_body: UK Chancellor Rishi Sunak has been cleared by PM Boris Johnson's ethics adviser of breaching ministerial rules over his wife Akshata Murty's non-dom status and the green card granting him residency in the US. The independent adviser Christopher Geidt said Sunak had declared his interests correctly and had been "assiduous in meeting his obligations and in engaging with this investigation".

143.title: Ex-Twitter CEO tells Musk 'bullying isn't leadership', he reacts
143.article_body: Former Twitter CEO Dick Costolo reacted to Elon Musk's response to Twitter's General Counsel Vijaya Gadde reportedly crying over his takeover and expressing concerns, saying, "Bullying is not leadership...You're making an executive at the company you just bought...target of harassment." In response, Musk said, "What are talking about? I'm just saying Twitter needs to be politically neutral."

144.title: India built ties with Russia out of necessity as we couldn't do it earlier: US
144.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken has said, "Russia, for India, was out of necessity a partner of choice when we were not in a position to be a partner." "Now, we are investing in that effort. I think there is a growing strategic convergence between the United States and India," Blinken further said.

145.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read after 40 matches?
145.article_body: Following the conclusion of 40 matches in IPL 2022, GT are on top of the points table with 14 points. RR are second on the points table with 12 points. They are followed by SRH, LSG and RCB, who have 10 points each. MI, who are yet to win a match in the tournament, are placed last on the table.

146.title: Muralitharan shouts in anger during last over of SRH-GT match, video goes viral
146.article_body: SRH's strategy and spin bowling coach Muttiah Muralitharan was seen shouting in anger when GT vice-captain Rashid Khan smashed SRH pacer Marco Jansen for a six in last over of their IPL 2022 match. Muralitharan stood up from his chair and purportedly said, "Why the f**k is he bowling full?" Jansen conceded 25 runs in the over as GT won.

147.title: Next I'm buying Coca-Cola to put the cocaine back in: Elon Musk
147.article_body: Days after he struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion, Tesla CEO Elon Musk tweeted, "Next I'm buying Coca-Cola to put the cocaine back in." Reacting to his tweet, a user wrote, "Can you buy the moon for me Elon? Earth has lots of wars going on," while another tweeted, "Buy TikTok and delete it."

148.title: Farmers send mango stock to Pune due to rains, prices slashed by 25%
148.article_body: Farmers from Konkan belt have started sending mango stock to Pune Market Yard due to unexpected rains. In last week, over 10,000 boxes of Alphonso mangoes have arrived in Market Yard. Due to increase in supply, prices of these mangoes have been reduced by at least  25%. Sale of mangoes is also increasing as Akshaya Tritiya is approaching.

149.title: 2 men die after falling into sewer pit in Delhi's Bawana
149.article_body: At least two men died after falling into a sewer pit in Delhi's Bawana area on Wednesday, officials said. The men were working near the spot when the accident took place, officials added. "The firemen pulled out the men...sent them to the Maharishi Valmiki Hospital where the doctors declared them brought dead," Delhi Fire Services (DFS) chief Atul Garg said.

150.title: SRH's Umran Malik records best bowling figures of IPL 2022
150.article_body: SRH fast bowler Umran Malik on Wednesday recorded the best bowling figures of IPL 2022. The 22-year-old pacer recorded figures of 4-0-25-5 against GT, registering his first-ever five-wicket haul in T20 cricket. The previous best bowling figures of IPL 2022 (4-0-40-5) were recorded by RR leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal against KKR on April 18.

151.title: 2-year-old boy dies after being attacked by stray dogs in Hyderabad
151.article_body: A two-year-old boy died after being attacked by a pack of stray dogs in Hyderabad, reports stated. The boy was playing near his house when the dogs attacked and dragged him to adjoining military area on Tuesday night. Meanwhile, locals have alleged that Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) failed to act though stray dogs pose a grave threat to them.

152.title: GT smash 4 sixes in last over to beat SRH on last ball, reclaim top spot on points table
152.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) defeated SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) by five wickets to reclaim the top spot on the IPL 2022 points table. GT chased down the target of 196 on their last delivery. Needing 22 runs in the last over, GT smashed four sixes and scored 25 runs to complete the chase. Rashid Khan slammed an unbeaten 31 off 11 deliveries.

153.title: COVID-19 situation in Karnataka is under control: CM Bommai
153.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Wednesday said the COVID-19 situation in the state is under control. He added that 2% of international passengers will be randomly tested and teletracking of passengers coming from Australia, Indonesia, New Zealand and South Korea will be carried out. Samples of hospitalised patients who are COVID-19 positive will be sent for genome sequencing, he added.

154.title: Imran Khan begged Pakistani army till last minute to save his govt: Maryam Nawaz
154.article_body: Pakistan's ousted Prime Minister Imran Khan was so desperate that he "begged" the military establishment till the last minute to save his government, Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) Vice President Maryam Nawaz has claimed. "He had even requested former President and PPP co-chairman Asif Ali Zardari to help him in the wake of a no-confidence motion against him," Maryam said.

155.title: James Murdoch's Bodhi Tree partners with Reliance to invest ₹13,500 cr in Viacom18
155.article_body: Reliance and Viacom18 have inked a partnership with Bodhi Tree to turn Viacom18 into "one of the largest TV and digital streaming companies" in India. Bodhi Tree is a platform run by James Murdoch's Lupa Systems and ex-Disney executive Uday Shankar. Reliance's JioCinema will also be transferred to Viacom18 as part of the Bodhi Tree-led ₹13,500-crore investment deal.

156.title: India in talks with Norway wealth fund, GIC over LIC IPO: Report
156.article_body: India is in talks to sign up Norway's sovereign wealth fund and Singapore's GIC Pte as anchor investors for LIC IPO, Bloomberg reported. As per its sources, Abu Dhabi Investment Authority, BlackRock Inc and Fidelity have been approached as well. The Centre is looking to finalise the anchor investor list within days, the report added.

157.title: He removed his bag to accommodate Viv's bag: Vivek Razdan on Kohli's gesture on flight
157.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Vivek Razdan recalled how Virat Kohli once removed his own bag from the overhead locker of a flight in the Caribbean to accommodate the bag of ex-West Indies captain Viv Richards, who was unable to find space. "Kohli...kept his bag below the seat ahead of him," Razdan added. "Richards tapped his shoulder and thanked him," he further said.

158.title: IAS officer booked after IRS officer wife's dowry harassment allegation in MP
158.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh police have filed a case against an Indian Administrative Service (IAS) officer after his wife accused him and his family members of dowry harassment. Police said that the woman is an Indian Revenue Service (IRS) officer. “Based on the complaint, a case was registered against the IAS officer, his mother and sister for dowry harassment,” police said.

159.title: 'Major' to release on June 3, will clash with Akshay's 'Prithviraj'
159.article_body: Adivi Sesh-starrer 'Major' has been postponed again and now will release on June 3. Previously, the film was slated to release on May 27. However, the actor announced on Twitter that the release has been pushed by a week. The film's release date had earlier been postponed due to the pandemic. The film will now clash with Akshay Kumar's 'Prithviraj'.

160.title: Your rules won't apply here: EU to Musk over Twitter deal
160.article_body: The European Union has warned that Elon Musk-owned Twitter will have to respect the bloc's rules regarding online content moderation. "Elon, there are rules...It's not your rules which will apply here," said EU Internal Market Chief Thierry Breton. He added that if Twitter fails to comply, the EU could fine 6% of its annual revenue or even ban it entirely.

161.title: Bomb threat letter found at railway station in Punjab's Kapurthala
161.article_body: A bomb threat letter was found at Sultanpur Lodhi Railway Station in Punjab's Kapurthala on Wednesday, ANI reported. The letter mentioned that major railway stations like Sultanpur Lodhi, Ferozepur and Jalandhar will be blown up by May 21 to avenge, ANI quoted the Station Master as saying. It also reportedly mentioned that Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann will also be attacked.

162.title: ₹1 lakh ex-gratia to those severely injured in Thanjavur incident
162.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin met those who were injured in the Thanjavur electrocution incident and announced ex-gratia of ₹1 lakh to those severely injured and ₹50,000 to the injured. "It is a tragic and painful incident. We have ordered officials to take action on this issue," he said. Eleven people were killed and 15 were injured in the incident.

163.title: I wish Musk the very best, our social media rules remain unchanged: MoS IT
163.article_body: Rajeev Chandrasekhar, the Union Minister of State (MoS) for Electronics and Information Technology, told ET, "I wish Elon Musk the very best," as the world's richest person struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion. He added that the government's goals and expectations of accountability and safety rules for all social media intermediaries, including Twitter, remain the same.

164.title: Man Utd's Rangnick accepts top-four finish in PL is not 'realistic'
164.article_body: Manchester United's interim manager Ralf Rangnick accepts that a top-four finish in the Premier League this season is not "realistic" ahead of their Premier League clash with Chelsea on Thursday. United are currently sixth on the table with 54 points with four games left. "Even if we win all four games, it's still not in our own hands," Rangnick said.

165.title: Australian minister accuses China of interference ahead of federal polls
165.article_body: Australian minister Karen Andrews on Wednesday suggested that China deliberately announced its security pact with Solomon Islands ahead of Australian federal polls in a bid to derail Liberal Party's re-election. She further claimed that China wants the Labor Party to win elections. Notably, Labor Party has claimed that Australian government's inability to stall pact is a foreign policy failure.

166.title: India has one language, which is entertainment: Sonu Sood on national language debate
166.article_body: Sonu Sood spoke about the ongoing debate on whether Hindi can be considered the national language of the country. "I don't think Hindi can be called just the national language. India has one language, which is entertainment," he said. "It doesn't really matter which industry you belong to. If you entertain people, they will love you...and accept you," Sonu added.

167.title: Danish teenager Rune beats world no. 3 Zverev in Munich
167.article_body: Danish teenager Holger Rune on Wednesday beat world number three Alexander Zverev 6-3, 6-2 at the ATP 250 tournament in Munich. "I have a lot of respect for him, and I obviously didn't expect to win in two sets, and with a score like this," the 18-year-old said. Rune's victory over Zverev is his first against a Top 10 opponent.

168.title: Opp'n hasn't reduced VAT on fuel, BJP did months before: Minister
168.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Wednesday said that the Opposition ruled states have not reduced taxes on fuel, despite BJP-led states having done it months before. "Opposition only looks at the Centre but does not reduce the taxes in their own states. Don't they want to benefit the people who voted them to power?" he said.

169.title: Indonesia widens export ban to include crude and refined palm oil
169.article_body: Indonesia has widened the scope of its export ban on raw materials for cooking oil to include crude and refined palm oil, Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto said on Wednesday. In a separate statement, President Joko Widodo said people's need for affordable food trumped revenue concerns. Export ban will be lifted once domestic needs are met, Widodo said.

170.title: Reliance, Apollo Global plan joint bid for UK pharma chain Boots: Report
170.article_body: Reliance Industries and US-based Apollo Global Management are planning a joint bid for UK's high street pharmacy chain Boots, the Financial Times reported. Both would own equity stakes in Boots under the plan, however, it's unclear whether the size of their stakes would be the same. Boots' US parent Walgreens Boots Alliance put the business for sale in December 2021.

171.title: Web space gave me visibility like never before: Sikandar Kher
171.article_body: Actor Sikandar Kher has said the OTT platform gave him visibility that he never got before. "As an actor, you need and want people to see your work and your abilities," he stated. "When you get that many eyeballs, filmmakers also get the chance to view you in their projects and the characters they create," Sikandar further added.

172.title: We need to take more chances: Foden on CL SF clash with Real Madrid
172.article_body: Phil Foden admitted Manchester City needed to "take more chances" after their Champions League semi-final first-leg clash on Tuesday. City won 4-3 despite having a two-goal advantage on three occasions. "It was a great game. End to end. We started really well and could have killed them off. In these games, we need to take more chances," Foden said.

173.title: World no.1 Swiatek withdraws from Madrid Open with shoulder injury
173.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek has withdrawn from the Madrid Open due to a right shoulder injury. "I need a break from playing so intensively in order to treat my arm well and that's why, unfortunately, I have to withdraw," the 20-year-old said.
