NASA has extended the University of Arizona-led mission, which will be renamed OSIRIS-APEX, to study near-Earth asteroid Apophis for 18 months. The mission will make its first manoeuvre toward Apophis 30 days after the OSIRIS-REx spacecraft delivers the sample it collected from Bennu in October 2020.

348.title: At least 4 Syrian soldiers killed in Israeli airstrikes: Report
348.article_body: At least four Syrian soldiers were reportedly killed and a few others injured in airstrikes carried out by Israel. Several missiles struck near the Syrian capital, Damascus, in the pre-dawn hours of Wednesday, according to a Britain-based war monitor. The attacks came hours after Israel said that one of its drones had crashed on the Syrian side of the border.

349.title: So much pain, no amount of pain killer is helping: Actress Chhavi after cancer surgery
349.article_body: After undergoing breast cancer surgery, actress Chhavi Mittal said, "It's amazing how quickly we forget pain. The pain I felt after C section...or the excruciating pain of my back injury which also healed." "Right now there's so much pain that no amount of pain killer is helping. What's helping...is seeing the smiles on the faces of well wishers," she added.

350.title: Baby dies after slipping from nurse's hands in Lucknow, father told he was born dead
350.article_body: A newborn boy died after slipping from a nurse's hands at a private hospital in Lucknow. His father said, "I was told the baby was stillborn. However, when I spoke to my wife, she said she saw him alive." He added, "She saw a nurse taking the baby in her hands without any towel, when he slipped through her hand."

351.title: It's chauvinistic to ask if my husband is okay with me working: Actress Sana
351.article_body: Actress Sana Sayyad, who features in 'Spy Bahu', spoke about how questions about her husband's comfort with her profession reek of chauvinism. She said, "I don't like when people ask 'if your husband is comfortable with you working'." "That question is weird and is (chauvinistic). I'm not doing anything absurd for him to not like it," she added.

352.title: Samson wasting opportunities to press for India recall: Ian Bishop
352.article_body: Ex-WI fast bowler Ian Bishop has said RR captain Sanju Samson is "wasting good opportunities" due to his shot selection in the ongoing IPL season. Samson was playing on 27 against RCB when he attempted to play the standing reverse sweep on consecutive deliveries off Wanindu Hasaranga and got out. So far, Samson has scored 228 runs in eight games.

353.title: Man in Lucknow for a house-warming party molests minor girl in lift
353.article_body: A trader who had come to Lucknow for a house-warming party, allegedly molested a 12-year-old girl in the elevator of the apartment building. He reportedly ran away after the girl started screaming. The girl started crying when she reached home and told her mother about the incident, after which, her parents filed an FIR.

354.title: Musk usually does what he says he is going to do: Billionaire investor Novogratz
354.article_body: Billionaire investor Mike Novogratz has tweeted, "The hysteria around Elon Musk buying Twitter is unsettling. While his style might not be for everyone, he usually does what he says he is going to do." "Give him a chance to remove the bots. For that alone we will all be thanking him," Novogratz wrote.

355.title: Action should be taken if Twitter interferes with free speech in India: Tharoor
355.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday said if Twitter is found either "interfering" with free speech in India or the opposite by permitting hate speech and abuse, then the IT committee should take action. "On Elon Musk: Who owns which social media company is not our concern. What matters is what they do and how," Tharoor tweeted.

356.title: Return ₹2.8 cr to mining firm for not honouring contract: HC to Punjab
356.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court has directed the Punjab government to return about ₹2.8 crore to a mining firm for not honouring a 2017 contract. The firm had got the contract for Lubangarh but no mining work was done amid protests from locals. Notably, the contract was later cancelled and the amount deposited was forfeited.

357.title: 4 held with brown sugar worth ₹2 crore in West Bengal's Siliguri
357.article_body: The West Bengal police on Tuesday arrested four people with 1 kg of brown sugar worth ₹2 crore in Siliguri. Two of the arrested persons are from Nadia district while the other two are from Murshidabad. According to the police, the accused are members of an organised drug cartel involved in supplying drugs in North Bengal.

358.title: What is histrionic personality disorder that psychologist says actress Amber Heard has?
358.article_body: Histrionic personality disorder, that a psychologist said actress Amber Heard has, is also known as a dramatic personality disorder, as per US' National Library of Medicine. It is distinguished by a pattern of exaggerated attention-seeking behaviours. For people with histrionic personality disorder, their self-esteem depends on the approval of others, as per Cleveland Clinic.

359.title: Section 144 imposed to prevent 'Hindu Mahapanchayat' in U'khand's Dada Jalalpur
359.article_body: Haridwar District Magistrate Vinay Shankar Pandey has said that prohibitory orders under CrPC section 144 have been enforced in Dada Jalalpur village near Uttarakhand's Roorkee and in areas within its five-km radius where a 'Hindu Mahapanchayat' was scheduled to be held on Wednesday. "The gathering will not be allowed to be held at any cost," SSP Yogendra Singh Rawat said.

360.title: Ukraine demolishes monument depicting its friendship with Russia
360.article_body: Ukraine on Tuesday demolished a monument in Kyiv which represented its historic ties with Russia. This comes amid the ongoing war between the two countries. "It took some effort but the Soviet sculpture of the two workers - symbolising the reunification of Ukraine and Russia - was dismantled," Kyiv Mayor Vitali Klitschko was quoted as saying.

361.title: Product of 'parivarvad' can't be sold: BJP on Prashant Kishor not joining Cong
361.article_body: Reacting to the Congress' announcement that poll strategist Prashant Kishor has declined the offer to join the party, BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla said that Congress' agenda is "parivar bachao (save the family)". "If the product is bad, no matter how good a salesman (might) be...you can't sell the product of parivarvad (dynasty politics) past its expiry date," he said.

362.title: Can't breathe, govt should take action: Locals near Bhalswa dump yard
362.article_body: Locals who live near Bhalswa dump yard, where a fire broke out on Tuesday, said that they are not able to breathe or see properly and that the government should take proper action on the situation of the dump yard, ANI reported. Reports also said that the dump yard was sending a dense plume of smoke into the sky.

363.title: Google-parent Alphabet's Q1 profit drops by over $1 billion
363.article_body: Google-parent Alphabet's net profit dropped to $16.4 billion in the first quarter compared to last year's $17.9 billion in the same quarter. Its revenue shot up 23% from the same period last year, reaching $68 billion. The company reported $54.66 billion in advertising revenue for the quarter, up from $44.68 billion the year prior.

364.title: 'Hate-in-India', Make-in-India can't coexist: Rahul Gandhi to PM Modi
364.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday tweeted about the exit of some global brands from India. "Modi ji, Hate-in-India and Make-in-India can't coexist!" he wrote on Twitter. The former Congress chief also shared a picture showing seven global brands, including Chevrolet, Harley Davidson, Man Trucks, Fiat, United Motors, Ford and Datsun, which have exited the country.

365.title: PM Modi to visit Germany, Denmark & France next week
365.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will be travelling to Germany, Denmark, and France between May 2-4, the Ministry of External Affairs said, adding, "This will be PM's first visit abroad in 2022." During his visit, he'll hold talks with German Chancellor Olaf Scholz and Denmark PM Mette Frederiksen, attend second India-Nordic Summit being hosted by Denmark, and meet French President Emmanuel Macron.

366.title: We're close to turning it all around: Ponting on DC losing 4 of their 7 games
366.article_body: DC head coach Ricky Ponting has said they need to get momentum as they're close to turning it around in IPL 2022. "There's 36 or 37 overs of really good stuff...[but] we just let it slip for two or three overs...we've got to believe...And things will definitely change for us," he added. DC have lost 4 of their 7 games.

367.title: India's largest IPO of LIC to open on May 4, price band ₹902-949 per share
367.article_body: Life Insurance Corporation's (LIC) IPO will open on May 4 and close on May 9, the company confirmed on Wednesday. The price band will be ₹902-949, with a ₹60 discount for policyholders and ₹45 discount for retail investors and employees. The IPO, through which the government is selling its 3.5% LIC stake to raise ₹20,557 crore, will be India's largest.

368.title: Air India proposes to acquire AirAsia India
368.article_body: Tata-owned Air India has proposed to acquire AirAsia India and has sought the deal's approval from the Competition Commission of India. AirAsia India is majority-owned by Tata Sons with a shareholding of 83.67% and the remaining stake is with AirAsia Investment Ltd (AAIL), part of Malaysia's AirAsia Group. Air India and Air India Express were acquired by Tata last year.

369.title: None of us should give advice to him, let the GOAT do his thing: RR's Riyan on idol Kohli
369.article_body: RR all-rounder Riyan Parag, who smashed a match-winning 56*(31) against RCB, reacted to ESPNcricinfo's tweet asking their followers about what advice they'd give to Virat Kohli amid his poor form. "None of us should, let the GOAT (Greatest of All Time) do his thing," Riyan wrote. The 20-year-old all-rounder considers Kohli as his idol.

370.title: MP Navneet Rana took loan of ₹80 lakh from builder Yusuf Lakdawala: Raut
370.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut has alleged that Maharashtra's Amravati MP Navneet Rana took a loan of ₹80 lakh from builder and film financier Yusuf Lakdawala, who died in jail in 2021. "Underworld connection of Rana has come up," he said. "Lakdawala was arrested by ED in a money laundering case of ₹200 crore...had links with 'D' gang," Raut added.

371.title: Action to continue against those trying to spread fake news: Anurag Thakur
371.article_body: A day after the government said it has blocked some YouTube news channels, Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Tuesday said such actions will continue against those who spread misinformation and propaganda. "Those trying to spread this kind of propaganda, fake news, myths and fear, strict action will be taken in future, too. We cannot compromise on country’s security," Thakur added.

372.title: Who are the top 10 celebrity influencers on Instagram, as Alia ranked above JLo?
372.article_body: Alia Bhatt has been ranked 6th on the list of top 10 celebrity influencers on Instagram, as per a report by Influencer Marketing Hub. Jennifer Lopez, Chris Hemsworth and Robert Downey Jr have been ranked seventh, ninth and tenth, respectively. Zendaya has topped the list, followed by Tom Holland, The Rock, J-Hope and Will Smith.

373.title: Tomorrow if push comes to shove, pull out of the IPL: Shastri on Kohli's poor form
373.article_body: Referring to Virat Kohli's poor form, ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said, "This year, he's already into IPL 2022, tomorrow if push comes to shove, pull out of...IPL...for all you care." Shastri added that a break would be ideal for Kohli for prolonging his international career. He further suggested players can even decide to play half of the tournament.

374.title: Mumbai woman fails to repay loan, recovery agent morphs her face on porn video
374.article_body: Mumbai Police have arrested a 19-year-old loan recovery agent from Karnataka for sending a morphed porn video of a woman to her cousin after the victim failed to repay a loan. The victim's cousin got the video on WhatsApp along with a message that said the victim was now working as a sex worker as she failed to repay loan.

375.title: Don't switch off engines at every traffic signal: BMTC to drivers
375.article_body: The Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) has instructed its midi bus drivers "not to switch off and restart the engine at every traffic signal to avoid an electrical shock circuit". The directive comes after an initial probe into three incidents of midi buses catching fire in the city this year revealed that the fires originated from the engine area.

376.title: K'taka Milk Federation asks K'taka govt to raise milk prices by ₹3/L
376.article_body: The Karnataka Milk Federation (KMF) has proposed to Karnataka government to raise the price of milk by ₹3/litre, citing 25%-30% rise in cost of raw materials and processing of milk. The KMF in its letter to CM Basavaraj Bommai said that other milk cooperatives in Karnataka have already raised milk prices but Nandini milk costs ₹8-10 less compared to them.

377.title: Man booked for sodomising 10-year-old nephew in Ludhiana
377.article_body: A 26-year-old man was booked for allegedly sodomising his 10-year-old nephew in Ludhiana’s Basant Nagar on Tuesday. The minor's parents had left him in the care of the accused man, the victim's mother said. "When we returned, my son said he was hurt and on being prodded he revealed that he had been sexually assaulted by the accused," she added.

378.title: There's Kapoor craze, wished our family to be like that in south: Chiranjeevi
378.article_body: Actor Chiranjeevi said that there is a "Kapoor craze" in the Hindi cinema and that he wished for his family to be like that in south cinema. "I'm so happy to see how these kids (from Pawan Kalyan to Allu Arjun and others) have grown up and made a name for themselves in cinema," Chiranjeevi added.

379.title: France's Atos moves services delivered from Russia to India, Turkey
379.article_body: French IT consulting group Atos is moving its services currently delivered from Russia to other countries, including India and Turkey, amid the ongoing Ukraine-Russia war. Atos said the feasibility of the move has required significant planning in terms of implications for business operations and employees based in Russia. Atos stock lost half of its market value last year.

380.title: Reports of attack on CRPF in Shopian false, it was accident: Police
380.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian Police on Tuesday said that media reports claiming an attack on a CRPF party are false. The incident, in which 10 jawans were injured, was actually an accident, it added. It said that the driver lost control over the vehicle due to some technical fault and it skidded off the road and turned turtle.

381.title: TRS celebrates 21-year anniversary, KCR joins plenary meeting in Hyd
381.article_body: Telangana CM and Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) chief K Chandrashekar Rao on Wednesday joined the party's 21-year anniversary celebrations at the Hyderabad International Convention Centre. A plenary meeting of the TRS is being held, where 11 resolutions will be passed. "Two decades ago...Sri KCR Garu founded TRS to make aspirations of Telangana people a reality," Telangana minister KTR tweeted.

382.title: Every game had an individual who stood out: Tewatia on GT winning 6 of 7 games
382.article_body: Talking about their performance in the ongoing IPL season, GT all-rounder Rahul Tewatia said they're not dependent on one or two players to win games and "every game [so far] had an individual who stood out". He added, "This is a team game, team matters. We are happy that there's always someone who ends up [taking responsibility]."

383.title: Cong has to put its house in order with or without consultant: Digvijaya
383.article_body: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh on Wednesday said that ultimately the party has to move and put its house in order, with or without a consultant. His remark came a day after both poll strategist Prashant Kishor and the Congress announced that Kishor has declined the offer to join the party's Empowered Action Group.

384.title: Blood of the Chinese cannot be shed in vain: China as Pak blast kills 3 Chinese teachers
384.article_body: After the suicide attack at the Karachi University which killed three Chinese teachers and injured another, China said, "The blood of the Chinese cannot be shed in vain, and those behind this incident will surely pay the price." China asked Pakistan to scale-up security for its nationals working in the country and demanded a thorough investigation.

385.title: Woman accuses Malayalam actor Vijay Babu of raping her, says 'He recorded my nude video'
385.article_body: A woman has accused Malayalam actor-producer Vijay Babu of raping her multiple times during the past 1.5 months. She stated that Vijay used to intoxicate her and sexually abuse. She also alleged that he recorded a nude video of her, adding, "I fear for his blackmail and for my safety." Vijay has been booked by police.

386.title: Doesn't matter, it's about not having to label everything: Harry on sexuality
386.article_body: Singer Harry Styles said that he has been "really open" about his sexuality with his friends but that it is his personal experience. "The whole point of where we should be heading...which is towards accepting everybody and being more open...is that it doesn't matter...and it's about not having to label everything...not having to clarify what boxes you're checking," he added.

387.title: Fatima fell out of jeep while it was in motion; we got scared: Thar director
387.article_body: 'Thar' director Raj Singh Chaudhary said the cast have put their blood and sweat into the film. He added, "Satish (Kaushik) climbed mountains and Anil (Kapoor)...was riding a bike on terrains." "There was one shot where Fatima...fell out of the jeep while it was in motion and we all got scared but she...brushed herself...and got into the jeep," he said.

388.title: Provide better connectivity to Bharatpur: Raj CM writes to Nitin Gadkari
388.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Tuesday wrote a letter to Union Minister Nitin Gadkari, seeking better road connectivity to Bharatpur, which is known for a popular bird sanctuary. Gehlot demanded an extension of the road connecting Paniyala Mod and Delhi-Mumbai Expressway up to Bharatpur. He further asked the highways minister to declare the Alwar-Bharatpur road as a national highway.

389.title: Trump's Truth Social beating Twitter & TikTok: Musk on pic of Apple Store's top charts
389.article_body: Elon Musk, who's buying Twitter for $44 billion, tweeted a screenshot of Apple Store's top charts. "Truth Social is currently beating Twitter & TikTok on...Apple Store," he wrote. Truth Social, an alt-tech social media platform, was founded by ex-US President Donald Trump in February. "That means you also buy Apple Store now and sort it out," a user jokingly wrote.

390.title: Watched how RCB bowled, kept it on good length: Kuldeep Sen on 4/20
390.article_body: RR pacer Kuldeep Sen, who picked four wickets against RCB, has revealed that he observed how Harshal Patel and Mohammed Siraj bowled and realised that the ball was stopping from a good length. "So, Sanju told me to hit the deck hard, the plan was to keep it on a good length," he added. RR won by 29 runs.

391.title: Robinhood fires 9% full-time employees, cites 'hyper growth'
391.article_body: Citing "hyper growth", Robinhood CEO Vlad Tenev has said the trading platform is firing 9% full-time employees. "This rapid headcount growth has led to some duplicate roles...and more layers and complexity than are optimal," Tenev added. "After carefully considering these factors, we determined that making these reductions to staff is the right decision to improve efficiency," Tenev further said.

392.title: US offers $10 mn reward for information on Russian intelligence officers
392.article_body: The US is offering a reward of up to $10 million for information on six Russian intelligence officers who'd allegedly conducted cyber-attacks affecting key US infrastructure. The officers, working for Russian military intelligence agency GRU, were involved in a 2017 global malware attack that infected the computers of many private US entities, including a hospital system, US State Department said.

393.title: Mumbai's KEM hospital to start paid ward facility from today
393.article_body: The BMC's King Edward Memorial (KEM) hospital, for the first time, will start the facility of 17-bed paid ward on pilot basis from today. The private ward at KEM will have AC beds tentatively priced at ₹1,200 daily and non-AC beds for ₹900 daily, an official said. Until now, BMC-run hospitals provided subsidised treatment and did not charge for beds.

394.title: 12-year-old boy arrested for raping 5-year-old girl in Jharkhand: Police
394.article_body: A 12-year-old boy has been arrested for allegedly raping a five-year-old girl in Torpa Police Station area in Jharkhand's Khunti district, police said on Tuesday. The incident took place on Saturday when the girl went to buy cold drink from a shop near her house, police added. The boy, who was alone there, allegedly raped her, police further said.

395.title: Nothing out of syllabus: Raj minister on Cong-related questions in exam
395.article_body: A day after the Union Ministry of Education wrote to the Rajasthan government over six Congress-related questions in Class XII state Board examination, Education Minister BD Kalla said that nothing was out of syllabus. "The RBSE (Rajasthan Board of Secondary Education) is an autonomous body and there is no interference from the state government," Kalla added.

396.title: 3 in 4 kids have had coronavirus infections in the US: Study
396.article_body: US' CDC researchers have estimated that three out of every four US children have been infected with the coronavirus. They also found that more than half of all Americans had signs of previous infections. In the case of Americans of all ages, about 34% had signs of prior infection in December and two months later 58% did.

397.title: Dad didn't have a childhood; he was on footpaths of Mumbai: Jaaved on Jagdeep
397.article_body: Actor Jaaved Jaaferi said his father Jagdeep didn't have a childhood. He was the bread earner of his family from the age of nine. "After Partition, everything was wiped out. [Dad] was on...streets. He was on...footpaths of Mumbai with his mother. He had to start from scratch," Jaaved added. "He had to fend for himself and his mother," Jaaved said.

398.title: Dad sung song even if he didn't like it, had no other way to earn money: Aditya
398.article_body: Singer Aditya Narayan said his father and singer Udit Narayan and his colleagues had to sing a song even if they didn't like it back in the day because there was no other way for them to earn money. "I'm earning my bread and butter from my career as host...So, I do not have to...compromise on my music," he added.

399.title: 2 men arrested for kidnapping 17-year-old girl in Mumbai
399.article_body: Two men have been arrested for kidnapping a 17-year-old girl in Mumbai, police said on Tuesday. The girl reportedly went missing on April 8 following which her mother filed a police complaint. According to police, the girl used her mother's mobile phone. "We...tracked down the most called number's location and found the girl in Juhu," a police officer said.

400.title: Delhi Metro begins constructing 5th bridge over river Yamuna
400.article_body: Delhi Metro has started work on a fifth bridge across river Yamuna under Phase-IV expansion of the Pink Line, officials said on Tuesday. The bridge, which is 560 metres long, will connect the Soorghat metro station with Sonia Vihar metro station on the corridor. "Pile foundation work is near completion...approximately 50% of sub-structure has been completed," a DMRC official said.

401.title: He will be hungry to perform: Piyush Chawla on Shubman Gill
401.article_body: Ahead of GT's match against SRH, cricketer-commentator Piyush Chawla said GT opener Shubman Gill will be hungry to perform after scoring a total of 27 runs in his last four games in IPL 2022. "Shubman did score runs in the initial matches but then hasn't been in great form," added Chawla. In GT's seven games, Shubman has scored 207 runs.

402.title: Saudi Arabia to buy 1 lakh EVs over 10 yrs: Luxury EV maker Lucid
402.article_body: Luxury EV maker Lucid has said that the government of Saudi Arabia has agreed to buy up to one lakh of its electric vehicles over the next ten years. Saudi Arabia's initial orders will be between 1,000 and 2,000 vehicles per year starting in 2023. It has committed to purchase 50,000 vehicles, with an option to buy an additional 50,000.

403.title: Ex-Myanmar leader Suu Kyi handed 5 year jail term for accepting $600,000 cash
403.article_body: A court in military-ruled Myanmar has sentenced ex-leader Aung San Suu Kyi to five years in jail after finding her guilty of corruption, Reuters reported quoting a source with knowledge of proceedings. The case centred on allegations that Suu Kyi accepted 11.4 kg of gold and cash payments totalling $600,000 from former Yangon chief minister Phyo Min Thein.

404.title: Did 17-18 films after 'Om..'; didn't have guidance, left good projects: Yuvika
404.article_body: Actress Yuvika Chaudhary said that she did 17-18 films after 'Om Shanti Om' but because she did not have guidance, she left a few "very good projects". "When you have no guidance in life or no godfather, it is a little different as you end up signing films. Then you feel you shouldn't have," she added.
